# applyReplacementIndexAttribute

**Type Property**

An option to add an attribute that marks replacements in localized strings.

## Declaration

```swift
static let applyReplacementIndexAttribute: AttributedString.FormattingOptions
```

## Discussion

When you use this option, string formatting applies the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/Key/replacementIndex] key to the final range of each replacement. Its value is an `Int`, wrapping the integer ordinal of that particular replacement, such as the `2` in `%2$@`. This allows the developer to relate ranges to replacements even if a localizer modifies the word order.
